oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Approximation schemes based on the use of experimental data to fit a Morse potential as the target PE curve EA(R) and chemically motivated parameterization schemes based on changes induced by electron-capture in the antibonding LUMO of the target (A) leading to lowering of bond order in the metastable anion (A(-)) and thereby larger bond length, lower dissociation energy, and force constant for the resonant compound anion to construct a Morse PE curve EA-(R) followed by the use of an exponentially decaying Gamma(A-) (R) which goes to zero at the crossing point between E-A (R) and EA- (R) to construct the anionic width function Gamma(A-) (R) such that the local complex potential (LCP) for the resonant anion WA- (R) is given by WA- (R) = EA- (R) - (i/2) Gamma(A-) (R) have been used to gain insight into the formation and decay of (2)Pi(g) N-2(-), (2)Pi Co- and 2 Sigma(+)(u) H-2(-) shape resonances. An analysis of the vibrational excitation cross-sections obtained from the use of these approximate LCPs in a time dependent wave packet scheme shows that the chemically motivated construction of the anionic LCP WA- (R), can be quite effective.
